aima.core.search.informed

Class GreedyBestFirstSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • aima.core.search.framework.PrioritySearch
      • aima.core.search.informed.BestFirstSearch
        • aima.core.search.informed.GreedyBestFirstSearch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SearchForActions, SearchForStates

    public class GreedyBestFirstSearch
extends BestFirstSearch
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 92.

    Greedy best-first search tries to expand the node that is closest to the goal, on the grounds that this is likely to lead to a solution quickly. Thus, it evaluates nodes by using just the heuristic function; that is, f(n) = h(n)
    Author:
    Ravi Mohan, Mike Stampone

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GreedyBestFirstSearch(QueueSearch impl, HeuristicFunction hf)
      Constructs a greedy best-first search from a specified search space exploration strategy and a heuristic function.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GreedyBestFirstSearch

        public GreedyBestFirstSearch(QueueSearch impl,
                             HeuristicFunction hf)
        Constructs a greedy best-first search from a specified search space exploration strategy and a heuristic function.
        Parameters:
        impl - a search space exploration strategy (e.g. TreeSearch, GraphSearch).
        hf - a heuristic function h(n), which estimates the cheapest path from the state at node n to a goal state.
